info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 16 at 8:05PM MDT until further notice by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Montana... Lodge Creek near International Border affecting Blaine and Hill Counties. .Melting snowpack and increased reservoir releases out of Canada will continue increased creek flows and minor flooding for several days. For the Lodge Creek...including International Border...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Lodge Creek near International Border. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 10.3 feet, April 24 2018 - No impacts were reported, yet areal flooding did occur because of snowmelt in northern Hill and northern Blaine counties. The gauge is actually in southern Alberta. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:25 PM MDT Sunday the stage was 7.7 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate within Minor flood stage for the next several days, with a maximum value 9.2 feet Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.2 feet on 06/04/1953. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 pm MDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Lodge Creek International Borde 7.0 7.7 Sun 7 pm MDT 7.2 7.3 7.8 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Monday morning at 1115 AM MDT.
